SEARCH
Package org.cloudbus.cloudsim

Class Host

java.lang.Object
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.Host
Direct Known Subclasses:
HddHost, HostDynamicWorkload, NetworkHost
public class Host extends Object
A Host is a Physical Machine (PM) inside a Datacenter. It is also called as a Server. It executes actions related to management of virtual machines (e.g., creation and destruction). A host has a defined policy for provisioning memory and bw, as well as an allocation policy for Pe's to virtual machines. A host is associated to a datacenter. It can host virtual machines.
Since:
CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
Author:
Rodrigo N. Calheiros, Anton Beloglazov

      public Host(int id, RamProvisioner ramProvisioner, BwProvisioner bwProvisioner, long storage, List<? extends Pe> peList, VmScheduler vmScheduler)
      Instantiates a new host.
      Parameters:
      id - the host id
      ramProvisioner - the ram provisioner
      bwProvisioner - the bw provisioner
      storage - the storage capacity
      peList - the host's PEs list
      vmScheduler - the vm scheduler

  • Method Details

    • updateVmsProcessing

      public double updateVmsProcessing(double currentTime)
      Requests updating of cloudlets' processing in VMs running in this host.
      Parameters:
      currentTime - the current time
      Returns:
      expected time of completion of the next cloudlet in all VMs in this host or Double.MAX_VALUE if there is no future events expected in this host
      Precondition:
      currentTime >= 0.0
      Postcondition:
      $none

      Returns:
      true, if is suitable for vm

    • setFailed

      public boolean setFailed(String resName, boolean failed)
      Sets the PEs of the host to a FAILED status. NOTE: resName is used for debugging purposes, which is ON by default. Use setFailed(boolean) if you do not want this information.
      Parameters:
      resName - the name of the resource
      failed - the failed
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise

    • setFailed

      public boolean setFailed(boolean failed)

      Parameters:
      failed - the failed
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise

    • setPeStatus

      public boolean setPeStatus(int peId, int status)
      Sets the particular Pe status on the host.
      Parameters:
      peId - the pe id
      status - Pe status, either Pe.FREE or Pe.BUSY
      Returns:
      true if the Pe status has changed, false otherwise (Pe id might not be exist)
      Precondition:
      peID >= 0
      Postcondition:
      $none
